info.title: pawaPay Mobile Money API
info.description:
pawaPay Mobile Money API allows you to send and receive mobile money in several African countries. Using pawaPay API, with just one integration you'll have access to millions of mobile money users in multiple countries and multiple mobile operators. 

# Introduction

Mobile Money (MM) is a service provided by Mobile Network Operators (MNO). A mobile money wallet is equivalent to a bank account where the mobile money user's phone number is the account number. Using our API, with one simple integration you can collect payments from and terminate disbursements to millions of mobile money wallets in several countries.

![pawaPay Solution](https://pawapay.co.uk/s/pawapay_solution.png)

pawaPay API supports these 2 main flows:
* **Payout (Disbursement)**
Using Payout API you can send mobile money from your account to the user's mobile money wallet which is his / her mobile number.

* **Deposit (Collection)**
Using Deposit API you can request a mobile money payment from your customers, for example in an online shop. When the request is sent, the user is asked to approve the transaction on his / her mobile phone.

# Payout (Disbursement)

In a payout flow you initiate a request to transfer money from your wallet to a user's wallet. In a payout flow, pawaPay receives your request and sends it to the proper mobile network operator in the destination country. Whenever the  mobile operator finalizes your payout request, it will inform pawaPay and consequently pawaPay informs you of the result through a webhook callback. If you couldn't receive the callback, you can always call our Payout Get API to get the latest status and details of a specific payout request. 

Your payout request can have one of the following statuses in pawaPay system:

Status | Description
-------|------------
`ACCEPTED` | The payout request has been accepted by pawaPay.
`PENDING` | The payout request is not yet submitted to the mobile operator.
`SUBMITTED` | The payout request has been submitted to the mobile operator, with no response yet.
`FAILED` | The payout request has failed. This is a **final state**. 
`COMPLETED` | The payout request has been successful. This is a **final state**.

Below sequence diagram demonstrates the high level flow of a payout request together with its different statuses:

![Payout Flow](https://pawapay.co.uk/s/pawapay_payout_flow.png)

# Deposit (Collection)

In the deposit flow you request money from a specific user, like the checkout process in an online shop or a mobile app. After the deposit request is sent to pawaPay, pawaPay sends the request to the mobile operator and consequently the mobile operator sends the request to the user's mobile for approval. User then confirms or rejects the request using his mobile phone. The approval mechanism is different for each mobile operator and in each country. It can be through SMS, USSD or specific applications. Upon user's approval (or rejection), mobile operators informs pawaPay of the result and pawaPay notifies you of the result by calling your deposit webhook callback. If you miss our callback, you can always check for the status of your deposit request through our Deposit Get API.

Your deposit request can have one of the following statuses in pawaPay system:

Status | Description
-------|------------
`ACCEPTED` | The deposit request has been accepted and has not processed internally.
`PENDING` | The deposit request is not yet submitted to the mobile operator.
`SUBMITTED` | The deposit request has been submitted to the mobile operator, with no response yet.
`FAILED` | The deposit request has failed. This is a **final state**.
`COMPLETED` | The deposit request has been successful. This is a **final state**.


Below sequence diagram demonstrates the high level flow of a deposit request together with its different statuses:

![Deposit Flow](https://pawapay.co.uk/s/pawapay_deposit_flow.png)

# Authentication
    
pawaPay uses bearer token authentication. An authorization header is required for all calls to pawaPay endpoint. When authentication fails, the error code 401 is returned and in case of authorization failure, pawaPay returns error code 403.

When using bearer token authentication, you access the API with an access token issued by pawaPay. To get your authentication token, please contact: [support@pawapay.co.uk](support@pawapay.co.uk)

post.description: Payouts operation allows you to submit a payout (disbursement) transaction request for asynchronous processing: * This API call is idempotent, which means it is safe to submit a request with the same payoutId multiple times. * Duplicate requests with the same payoutId will be ignored with the `DUPLICATE_IGNORED` status in the PayoutCreationResponse. * Since the request can be partially or fully rejected, you must check HTTP status code and analyze PayoutCreationResponse for each submitted request. Each request can become either ACCEPTED, REJECTED or DUPLICATE_IGNORED: Status | Description -------|------------ `ACCEPTED` | The payout creation request has been accepted. `REJECTED` | The payout creation request has been rejected. See `rejectionReason` for details. `DUPLICATE_IGNORED` | The payout creation request has been ignored as a duplicate of an already accepted payout request. Duplication logic relies upon payoutId.

200.description: Request has been processed by pawaPay

rejectionReason.rejectionMessage: Amount should not be greater than 1000

400.description: Request is rejected due to incompatibility with pawaPay API specification

value.errorMessage: Invalid input: Missing required creator property 'amount'

401.description: Authentication Failure. Please check your authentication token

403.description: Authorization Failure. Please check your authentication token

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url http://undefinedundefined/payouts \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN' \
  --data '{"payoutId":"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639","amount":"15.21","currency":"ZMW","country":"ZMB","correspondent":"MTN_MOMO_ZMB","recipient":{"type":"MSISDN","address":{"value":"256780334452"}},"customerTimestamp":"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z","statementDescription":"Up to 22 chars note"}'

echo '{"payoutId":"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639","amount":"15.21","currency":"ZMW","country":"ZMB","correspondent":"MTN_MOMO_ZMB","recipient":{"type":"MSISDN","address":{"value":"256780334452"}},"customerTimestamp":"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z","statementDescription":"Up to 22 chars note"}' |  \
  http POST http://undefinedundefined/payouts \
  Authorization:'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'

import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPConnection("undefinedundefined")

payload = "{\"payoutId\":\"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639\",\"amount\":\"15.21\",\"currency\":\"ZMW\",\"country\":\"ZMB\",\"correspondent\":\"MTN_MOMO_ZMB\",\"recipient\":{\"type\":\"MSISDN\",\"address\":{\"value\":\"256780334452\"}},\"customerTimestamp\":\"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z\",\"statementDescription\":\"Up to 22 chars note\"}"

headers = { 'Authorization': "Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN" }

conn.request("POST", "/payouts", payload, headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "http://undefinedundefined/payouts",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => "{\"payoutId\":\"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639\",\"amount\":\"15.21\",\"currency\":\"ZMW\",\"country\":\"ZMB\",\"correspondent\":\"MTN_MOMO_ZMB\",\"recipient\":{\"type\":\"MSISDN\",\"address\":{\"value\":\"256780334452\"}},\"customerTimestamp\":\"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z\",\"statementDescription\":\"Up to 22 chars note\"}",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

<?php

$request = new HttpRequest();
$request->setUrl('http://undefinedundefined/payouts');
$request->setMethod(HTTP_METH_POST);

$request->setHeaders([
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'
]);

$request->setBody('{"payoutId":"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639","amount":"15.21","currency":"ZMW","country":"ZMB","correspondent":"MTN_MOMO_ZMB","recipient":{"type":"MSISDN","address":{"value":"256780334452"}},"customerTimestamp":"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z","statementDescription":"Up to 22 chars note"}');

try {
  $response = $request->send();

  echo $response->getBody();
} catch (HttpException $ex) {
  echo $ex;
}

<?php

$client = new http\Client;
$request = new http\Client\Request;

$body = new http\Message\Body;
$body->append('{"payoutId":"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639","amount":"15.21","currency":"ZMW","country":"ZMB","correspondent":"MTN_MOMO_ZMB","recipient":{"type":"MSISDN","address":{"value":"256780334452"}},"customerTimestamp":"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z","statementDescription":"Up to 22 chars note"}');

$request->setRequestUrl('http://undefinedundefined/payouts');
$request->setRequestMethod('POST');
$request->setBody($body);

$request->setHeaders([
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'
]);

$client->enqueue($request)->send();
$response = $client->getResponse();

echo $response->getBody();

post.description: Bulk payouts operation allows you to submit multiple payout transactions for asynchronous processing: * Bulk requests with more than 20 payout transactions can be rejected by pawaPay. * This API call is idempotent, which means it is safe to submit a request with the same payoutId multiple times. * Duplicate requests with the same payoutId will be ignored with the `DUPLICATE_IGNORED` status in the PayoutCreationResponse. * Since the request can be partially or fully rejected, you must check HTTP status code and analyze PayoutCreationResponse for each submitted request. Every single transaction in a bulk request can become either ACCEPTED, REJECTED or DUPLICATE_IGNORED: Status | Description -------|------------ `ACCEPTED` | The payout creation request has been accepted. `REJECTED` | The payout creation request has been rejected. See `rejectionReason` for details. `DUPLICATE_IGNORED` | The payout creation request has been ignored as a duplicate of an already accepted payout request. Duplication logic relies upon payoutId.

200.description: Request has been processed by pawaPay

rejectionReason.ejectionMessage: Amount should not be greater than 1000

400.description: Request is rejected due to incompatibility with pawaPay API specification

value.errorMessage: Invalid input: Missing required creator property 'amount'

401.description: Authentication Failure. Please check your authentication token

403.description: Authorization Failure. Please check your authentication token

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url http://undefinedundefined/payouts/bulk \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN' \
  --data '[{"payoutId":"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639","amount":"15.21","currency":"ZMW","country":"ZMB","correspondent":"MTN_MOMO_ZMB","recipient":{"type":"MSISDN","address":{"value":"256780334452"}},"customerTimestamp":"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z","statementDescription":"Up to 22 chars note"}]'

echo '[{"payoutId":"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639","amount":"15.21","currency":"ZMW","country":"ZMB","correspondent":"MTN_MOMO_ZMB","recipient":{"type":"MSISDN","address":{"value":"256780334452"}},"customerTimestamp":"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z","statementDescription":"Up to 22 chars note"}]' |  \
  http POST http://undefinedundefined/payouts/bulk \
  Authorization:'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'

import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPConnection("undefinedundefined")

payload = "[{\"payoutId\":\"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639\",\"amount\":\"15.21\",\"currency\":\"ZMW\",\"country\":\"ZMB\",\"correspondent\":\"MTN_MOMO_ZMB\",\"recipient\":{\"type\":\"MSISDN\",\"address\":{\"value\":\"256780334452\"}},\"customerTimestamp\":\"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z\",\"statementDescription\":\"Up to 22 chars note\"}]"

headers = { 'Authorization': "Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN" }

conn.request("POST", "/payouts/bulk", payload, headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "http://undefinedundefined/payouts/bulk",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => "[{\"payoutId\":\"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639\",\"amount\":\"15.21\",\"currency\":\"ZMW\",\"country\":\"ZMB\",\"correspondent\":\"MTN_MOMO_ZMB\",\"recipient\":{\"type\":\"MSISDN\",\"address\":{\"value\":\"256780334452\"}},\"customerTimestamp\":\"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z\",\"statementDescription\":\"Up to 22 chars note\"}]",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

<?php

$request = new HttpRequest();
$request->setUrl('http://undefinedundefined/payouts/bulk');
$request->setMethod(HTTP_METH_POST);

$request->setHeaders([
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'
]);

$request->setBody('[{"payoutId":"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639","amount":"15.21","currency":"ZMW","country":"ZMB","correspondent":"MTN_MOMO_ZMB","recipient":{"type":"MSISDN","address":{"value":"256780334452"}},"customerTimestamp":"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z","statementDescription":"Up to 22 chars note"}]');

try {
  $response = $request->send();

  echo $response->getBody();
} catch (HttpException $ex) {
  echo $ex;
}

<?php

$client = new http\Client;
$request = new http\Client\Request;

$body = new http\Message\Body;
$body->append('[{"payoutId":"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639","amount":"15.21","currency":"ZMW","country":"ZMB","correspondent":"MTN_MOMO_ZMB","recipient":{"type":"MSISDN","address":{"value":"256780334452"}},"customerTimestamp":"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z","statementDescription":"Up to 22 chars note"}]');

$request->setRequestUrl('http://undefinedundefined/payouts/bulk');
$request->setRequestMethod('POST');
$request->setBody($body);

$request->setHeaders([
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'
]);

$client->enqueue($request)->send();
$response = $client->getResponse();

echo $response->getBody();

get.description: Get payout transaction status and payout details by the `payoutId` that you have specified in your payout request. A list with at most one Payout is returned.

parameters.name: payoutId
parameters.description: payoutId which has been specified in PayoutCreationRequest.

200.description: Request has been processed by pawaPay

400.description: Request is rejected due to incompatibility with pawaPay API specification

401.description: Authentication Failure. Please check your authentication token

403.description: Authorization Failure. Please check your authentication token

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request GET \
  --url http://undefinedundefined/payouts/%7BpayoutId%7D \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'

http GET http://undefinedundefined/payouts/%7BpayoutId%7D \
  Authorization:'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'

import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPConnection("undefinedundefined")

headers = { 'Authorization': "Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN" }

conn.request("GET", "/payouts/%7BpayoutId%7D", headers=headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "http://undefinedundefined/payouts/%7BpayoutId%7D",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "GET",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

<?php

$request = new HttpRequest();
$request->setUrl('http://undefinedundefined/payouts/%7BpayoutId%7D');
$request->setMethod(HTTP_METH_GET);

$request->setHeaders([
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'
]);

try {
  $response = $request->send();

  echo $response->getBody();
} catch (HttpException $ex) {
  echo $ex;
}

<?php

$client = new http\Client;
$request = new http\Client\Request;

$request->setRequestUrl('http://undefinedundefined/payouts/%7BpayoutId%7D');
$request->setRequestMethod('GET');
$request->setHeaders([
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'
]);

$client->enqueue($request)->send();
$response = $client->getResponse();

echo $response->getBody();

post.description: Deposits operation allows you to submit a deposit (collection) transaction request for asynchronous processing: * This API call is idempotent, which means it is safe to submit a request with the same `depositId` multiple times. * Duplicate requests with the same `depositId` will be ignored with the `DUPLICATE_IGNORED` status in the DepositCreationResponse. * Since the request can be partially or fully rejected, you must check HTTP status code and analyze DepositCreationResponse for each submitted request. Each request can become either ACCEPTED, REJECTED or DUPLICATE_IGNORED: Status | Description -------|------------ `ACCEPTED` | The deposit creation request has been accepted. `REJECTED` | The deposit creation request has been rejected. See `rejectionReason` for details. `DUPLICATE_IGNORED` | The deposit creation request has been ignored as a duplicate of an already accepted deposit request. Duplication logic relies upon depositId.

200.description: Request has been processed by pawaPay

rejectionReason.rejectionMessage: Amount should not be greater than 1000

400.description: Request is rejected due to incompatibility with pawaPay API specification

value.errorMessage: Invalid input: Missing required creator property 'amount'

401.description: Authentication Failure. Please check your authentication token

403.description: Authorization Failure. Please check your authentication token

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url http://undefinedundefined/deposits \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN' \
  --data '{"depositId":"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639","amount":"15.21","currency":"ZMW","country":"ZMB","correspondent":"MTN_MOMO_ZMB","payer":{"type":"MSISDN","address":{"value":"256780334452"}},"customerTimestamp":"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z","statementDescription":"Up to 22 chars note"}'

echo '{"depositId":"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639","amount":"15.21","currency":"ZMW","country":"ZMB","correspondent":"MTN_MOMO_ZMB","payer":{"type":"MSISDN","address":{"value":"256780334452"}},"customerTimestamp":"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z","statementDescription":"Up to 22 chars note"}' |  \

  Authorization:'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'

<?php

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "http://undefinedundefined/deposits",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => "{\"depositId\":\"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639\",\"amount\":\"15.21\",\"currency\":\"ZMW\",\"country\":\"ZMB\",\"correspondent\":\"MTN_MOMO_ZMB\",\"payer\":{\"type\":\"MSISDN\",\"address\":{\"value\":\"256780334452\"}},\"customerTimestamp\":\"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z\",\"statementDescription\":\"Up to 22 chars note\"}",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

<?php

$request = new HttpRequest();
$request->setUrl('http://undefinedundefined/deposits');
$request->setMethod(HTTP_METH_POST);

$request->setHeaders([
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'
]);

$request->setBody('{"depositId":"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639","amount":"15.21","currency":"ZMW","country":"ZMB","correspondent":"MTN_MOMO_ZMB","payer":{"type":"MSISDN","address":{"value":"256780334452"}},"customerTimestamp":"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z","statementDescription":"Up to 22 chars note"}');

try {
  $response = $request->send();

  echo $response->getBody();
} catch (HttpException $ex) {
  echo $ex;
}

<?php

$client = new http\Client;
$request = new http\Client\Request;

$body = new http\Message\Body;
$body->append('{"depositId":"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639","amount":"15.21","currency":"ZMW","country":"ZMB","correspondent":"MTN_MOMO_ZMB","payer":{"type":"MSISDN","address":{"value":"256780334452"}},"customerTimestamp":"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z","statementDescription":"Up to 22 chars note"}');

$response = $client->getResponse();

echo $response->getBody();

post.description: Bulk deposits operation allows you to submit multiple deposit transactions for asynchronous processing: * Bulk requests with more than 20 deposit transactions can be rejected by pawaPay. * This API call is idempotent, which means it is safe to submit a request with the same depositId multiple times. * Duplicate requests with the same depositId will be ignored with the `DUPLICATE_IGNORED` status in the DepositCreationResponse. * Since the request can be partially or fully rejected, you must check HTTP status code and analyze DepositCreationResponse for each submitted request. Every single transaction in a bulk request can become either ACCEPTED, REJECTED or DUPLICATE_IGNORED: Status | Description -------|------------ `ACCEPTED` | The deposit creation request has been accepted. `REJECTED` | The deposit creation request has been rejected. See `rejectionReason` for details. `DUPLICATE_IGNORED` | The deposit creation request has been ignored as a duplicate of an already accepted deposit request. Duplication logic relies upon depositId.

200.description: Request has been processed by pawaPay

rejectionReason.ejectionMessage: Amount should not be greater than 1000

400.description: Request is rejected due to incompatibility with pawaPay API specification

value.errorMessage: Invalid input: Missing required creator property 'amount'

  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => "[{\"depositId\":\"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639\",\"amount\":\"15.21\",\"currency\":\"ZMW\",\"country\":\"ZMB\",\"correspondent\":\"MTN_MOMO_ZMB\",\"payer\":{\"type\":\"MSISDN\",\"address\":{\"value\":\"256780334452\"}},\"customerTimestamp\":\"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z\",\"statementDescription\":\"Up to 22 chars note\"}]",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

<?php

$request = new HttpRequest();
$request->setUrl('http://undefinedundefined/deposits/bulk');
$request->setMethod(HTTP_METH_POST);

$request->setHeaders([
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'
]);

$request->setBody('[{"depositId":"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639","amount":"15.21","currency":"ZMW","country":"ZMB","correspondent":"MTN_MOMO_ZMB","payer":{"type":"MSISDN","address":{"value":"256780334452"}},"customerTimestamp":"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z","statementDescription":"Up to 22 chars note"}]');

try {
  $response = $request->send();

  echo $response->getBody();
} catch (HttpException $ex) {
  echo $ex;
}

<?php

$client = new http\Client;
$request = new http\Client\Request;

$body = new http\Message\Body;
$body->append('[{"depositId":"f4401bd2-1568-4140-bf2d-eb77d2b2b639","amount":"15.21","currency":"ZMW","country":"ZMB","correspondent":"MTN_MOMO_ZMB","payer":{"type":"MSISDN","address":{"value":"256780334452"}},"customerTimestamp":"2020-02-21T17:32:28Z","statementDescription":"Up to 22 chars note"}]');

$request->setRequestUrl('http://undefinedundefined/deposits/bulk');
$request->setRequestMethod('POST');
$request->setBody($body);

$request->setHeaders([
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'
]);

$client->enqueue($request)->send();
$response = $client->getResponse();

echo $response->getBody();

get.description: Get deposit transaction status and deposit details by `depositId` which has been specified in DepositCreationRequest. A list with at most one `Deposit` is returned.

parameters.name: depositId
parameters.description: payoutId which has been specified in DepositCreationRequest.

200.description: Request has been processed by pawaPay

suspiciousActivityReport.comment: There is a discrepancy between requested and actual deposit amount has been detected.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request GET \
  --url http://undefinedundefined/deposits/%7BdepositId%7D \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'

http GET http://undefinedundefined/deposits/%7BdepositId%7D \
  Authorization:'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'

import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPConnection("undefinedundefined")

headers = { 'Authorization': "Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN" }

conn.request("GET", "/deposits/%7BdepositId%7D", headers=headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "http://undefinedundefined/deposits/%7BdepositId%7D",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "GET",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

<?php

$request = new HttpRequest();
$request->setUrl('http://undefinedundefined/deposits/%7BdepositId%7D');
$request->setMethod(HTTP_METH_GET);

$request->setHeaders([
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'
]);

try {
  $response = $request->send();

  echo $response->getBody();
} catch (HttpException $ex) {
  echo $ex;
}

<?php

$client = new http\Client;
$request = new http\Client\Request;

$request->setRequestUrl('http://undefinedundefined/deposits/%7BdepositId%7D');
$request->setRequestMethod('GET');
$request->setHeaders([
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'
]);

$client->enqueue($request)->send();
$response = $client->getResponse();

echo $response->getBody();

bearer_authentication.description: pawaPay API uses bearer authentication as its security scheme.

value.description:
The value of the financial address, based on address type. In case of MSISDN, the format is (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MSISDN).

MSISDN validation has following rules: 1. Only digits without whitespaces or any other separators or prefixes like '+'. 2. Should not start with zero. 3. Country code is mandatory. 4. Should not exceed or less than the valid length of specified country.

Permitted samples for country code GHA:
233558708954, 233558708955

Not permitted samples for country code GHA:
+233558708954, 233 558 708954, 233-558-708954, 0233558708954, 233558708, 233558708954872, 999558708954, 37255870895

Amount.description:
Amount validation has following rules: 1. Between zero and four decimal places can be supplied. 2. A maximum of 18 integer places are allowed. 3. Leading zeroes are not permitted except where the value is less than 1. For any value less than one, one and only one leading zero must be supplied. 4. Trailing zeroes are permitted. 5. Only values greater than ZERO are permitted. 6. Maximum value that can be supplied is 999999999999999999.9999

Permitted samples:
5, 5.0, 5.00, 5.5, 5.50, 5.5555, 555555555555555555, 0.5

Not permitted samples:
5., 5.55555, 5555555555555555555, .5, -5.5, 00.5, 00.00, 00001.32

Correspondent.description: The name of the financial provider

Country.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-3, three character country code in upper case (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-3#Officially_assigned_code_elements)

Currency.description: The ISO 4217 three character currency code in upper case (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes)

depositId.description: The ID used for the deposit in the customers internal system.

customerTimestamp.description: The customer’s timestamp for when they initiated the deposit process. Format defined by 'date-time' in RFC3339 section 5.6 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6)

statementDescription.description: The message that will be sent to the recipient of this deposit.

created.description: The timestamp of when the deposit was created in the pawaPay system. Format defined by 'date-time' in RFC3339 section 5.6 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6)

respondedByPayer.description: When the deposit request was responded by the payer. Format defined by 'date-time' in RFC3339 section 5.6 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6)

correspondentIds.description: The ID-s used by the correspondent

depositId.description: A unique customer-side payout identifier. Only ASCII printable characters are allowed.

customerTimestamp.description: The customer’s timestamp for when they initiated the deposit process. Used for end-to-end transparency. Format defined by 'date-time' in RFC3339 section 5.6 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6)

statementDescription.description: The message that will be sent to the recipient of this deposit.

depositId.description: A unique deposit identifier provided by customer in DepositCreationRequest.

created.description: The timestamp of when the deposit was created in the pawaPay system. Format defined by 'date-time' in RFC3339 section 5.6 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6)

DepositCreationStatus.description:
Enumeration presenting the status of the `DepositCreationResponse`: 
* `ACCEPTED` - The deposit creation request has been accepted. 
* `REJECTED` - The deposit creation request has been rejected. See `DepositRejectionReason` for details 
* `DUPLICATE_IGNORED` - This deposit creation request is duplicated and will be ignored.

failureCode.description:
Enumeration presenting details in case of failure: 
* `PAYER_NOT_FOUND` - Payer not found. 
* `PAYMENT_NOT_APPROVED` - Payer did not approve the payment. 
* `PAYER_LIMIT_REACHED` - Payer has reached the limit. 
* `NOT_ENOUGH_FUNDS` - Payer does not have enough funds. 
* `OTHER_ERROR` - Any other error. Please refer to `failureMessage` and contact support.

rejectionCode.description:
Enumeration presenting details in case of failure:
* `INVALID_PAYER_FORMAT` - The payer address is invalid. 
* `INVALID_AMOUNT` - The specified amount is not supported. 
* `AMOUNT_TOO_SMALL` - The specified amount is below the accepted limit. 
* `AMOUNT_TOO_LARGE` - The specified amount is above the accepted limit. 
* `INVALID_CURRENCY` - The specified currency either does not exist or is not supported for this correspondent or payer. 
* `INVALID_COUNTRY` - The specified country either does not exist or is not supported for this correspondent or payer. 
* `PARAMETER_INVALID` - One or more parameters are invalid. 
* `RATE_LIMIT` - The number of allowed requests within a certain time period are exceeded. 
* `DEPOSITS_NOT_ALLOWED` - Deposits are not allowed for this customer, this correspondent or this payer.

rejectionMessage.example: You don't have access to this correspondent

DepositStatus.description:
Enumeration presenting the status of the deposit: 
* `ACCEPTED` - The deposit request has been accepted and has not processed internally. 
* `PENDING` - The deposit request is not yet submitted to the correspondent. 
* `SUBMITTED` - The deposit request has been submitted to the correspondent, with no response yet. 
* `CANCELED` - Final state. The deposit request was canceled by the customer. 
* `FAILED` - Final state. The deposit request has failed. 
* `COMPLETED` - Final state. The deposit request has been successful.

activityType.description: Represents a suspicious activity category * AMOUNT_DISCREPANCY - Indicates that there is a discrepancy between requested and actual deposit amount has been detected.

comment.example: There is a discrepancy between requested and actual deposit amount has been detected.

errorId.description: A unique error ID in pawaPay system.

payoutId.description: A customer-side payout identifier which has been specified in PayoutCreationRequest.

customerTimestamp.description: A customer-side payout initiation timestamp. Format defined by 'date-time' in RFC3339 section 5.6 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6)

statementDescription.description: The message that will be sent to the recipient of this payout.

created.description: pawaPay-side payout initiation timestamp. Format defined by 'date-time' in RFC3339 section 5.6 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6)

receivedByRecipient.description: When the payment was received by the recipient. Format defined by 'date-time' in RFC3339 section 5.6 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6)

correspondentIds.description: The ids used by the correspondent

payoutId.description: A unique customer-side payout identifier. Only ASCII printable characters are allowed.

customerTimestamp.description: A customer-side payout initiation timestamp. Used for end-to-end transparency. Format defined by 'date-time' in RFC3339 section 5.6 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6)

statementDescription.description: The message that will be sent to the recipient of this payout.

payoutId.description: A unique payout identifier provided by customer in PayoutCreationRequest.

created.description: The timestamp of when the payout was created in the pawaPay system. Format defined by 'date-time' in RFC3339 section 5.6 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6)

PayoutCreationStatus.description:
Enumeration presenting the status of the Payout Creation: 
* `ACCEPTED` - The payout creation request has been accepted. 
* `REJECTED` - The payout creation request has been rejected. See rejectionReason for details. 
* `DUPLICATE_IGNORED` - The payout creation request has been ignored as a duplicate of already accepted payout creation request. Duplication logic relies upon payoutId.

failureCode.description:
Enumeration presenting details in case of failure: 
* `BALANCE_INSUFFICIENT` - The customer’s balance is insufficient to proceed with the payout. 
* `RECIPIENT_NOT_FOUND` - Recipient not found. 
* `RECIPIENT_NOT_ALLOWED_TO_RECEIVE` - Recipient cannot receive funds due to e.g. transfer limit. 
* `RECIPIENT_LIMIT_REACHED` - Recipient has reached the limit 
* `OTHER_ERROR` - Any other error. Please refer to `failureMessage` and contact support.

rejectionCode.description:
Enumeration presenting details in case of failure: 
* `BALANCE_INSUFFICIENT` - The customer’s balance is insufficient to proceed with the payout. 
* `INVALID_RECIPIENT_FORMAT` - The account number (MSISDN etc) specified is invalid. 
* `INVALID_AMOUNT`- The specified amount is not supported. 
* `AMOUNT_TOO_SMALL` - The specified amount is below the accepted limit. 
* `AMOUNT_TOO_LARGE` - The specified amount is above the accepted limit. 
* `INVALID_CURRENCY` - The specified currency either does not exist or is not supported for the target account. 
* `INVALID_COUNTRY` - The specified country either does not exist or is not supported for this correspondent. 
* `PARAMETER_INVALID` - One or more parameters are invalid. 
* `RATE_LIMIT` - The number of allowed requests within a certain time period are exceeded. 
* `PAYOUTS_NOT_ALLOWED` - Payouts are not allowed for this customer, this correspondent or this recipient.

rejectionMessage.example: You don't have access to this correspondent

PayoutStatus.description:
Enumeration presenting the status of the payout: 
* `ACCEPTED` - The payout request has been accepted by pawaPay. 
* `PENDING` - The payout request is not yet submitted to the correspondent. 
* `SUBMITTED` - The payout request has been submitted to the correspondent, with no response yet. 
* `CANCELED` - Final state. The payout request was canceled by the customer. 
* `FAILED` - Final state. The payout request has failed. 
* `COMPLETED` - Final state. The payout request has been successful.

post.description: For every payout request pawaPay will inform you of the transaction result through a webhook callback. If you couldn't receive the callback you can always call our Payout Get API to get the latest status and details of a specific payout request.

For every deposit request pawaPay will inform you of the transaction result through a webhook callback. If you couldn't receive the callback you can always call our Deposit Get API to get the latest status and details of a specific deposit request.
